description: Feature collected user location data. Required full DPR which took 3 weeks. Had to add data retention policy and user consent dialog.
Feature processed user search history. Standard privacy review took 2 weeks. No major findings.
Terms of Service update required for new data collection. Legal required 2 rounds of revision.
Standard security review for API endpoint changes. No vulnerabilities found.
Required additional capacity planning for 3x traffic increase. SRE mandated rate limiting.
Payments team had a Q4 code freeze. Feature launch delayed by 4 weeks waiting for API changes.
Launch was blocked at the privacy gate. The feature's data retention policy was missing. Required emergency review.
Legal flagged missing accessibility compliance for EU market. Required UI changes and re-review.
P1 incident 2 days post-launch. Location service caused 5x increase in API calls, exceeding rate limits.
Engineers added real-time location tracking (not in original design). Added 2 weeks and triggered additional privacy review.
Initial DPR rejected due to inadequate anonymization of user movement patterns. Required architecture redesign.
Search team's API v3 was delayed by 3 weeks. Had to use v2 with workarounds, adding technical debt.
Security review passed on first attempt. All API endpoints properly authenticated and encrypted.
Location feature added 200ms to page load. Required optimization sprint to meet latency targets.
GDPR compliance review for EU users' location data. Required DPA amendments and cookie consent updates.
